title: Am I a loser for not having a career I wanted? - Quora

response.answer_text: Since I was about 12 years old, I have wanted to be an English teacher. I had this whole plan for my life. I would finish middle school, go through 4 years of college, get a teaching job, wife, kids, etc. I planned on graduating college at 22. Due to my own flaws and some unexpected circumstances, I had to withdraw from college twice. I am now 22 and taking online classes as a freshman. Do I think you are a loser? Absolutely not. You just need to keep trying. If you don’t have the career you want, work harder to get there. I have always been taught that it is better to make just enough money in a job you love, than to make millions of dollars doing something you hate. The key to success is to learn from your mistakes and correct them. Did you fail a test? Study harder next time. Are you not getting enough sleep? Go to bed earlier. So don’t give up on your dreams just because you failed. As long as you still have the will to try, there is hope.

Only you can decide the answer to this question. I did not have the career I wanted, and never considered myself a loser. In my case: I wanted to be a research scientist and got my masters degree in physics. I was married to a medical doctor, and his practice took him to a rural area. There was no point in going further for my Phd. There were no universities or research institutes around. So I studied for a second career, and became an industrial accountant. I was controller (finance manager) of Allied Chemical. I did not think of myself as being a loser. I am retired now, and unfortunately lost my husband, he died 6 months ago. I am devastated, but using my time trying to catch up with science where I left it so many years ago. Not easy, because not only I need to learn what is new since then, and plenty, but I also forgot a lot. But I have all the time and this time around it is not for a career.

Am I a loser for not having a career I wanted? Absolutely not. I wanted to be an architect when I was in grade school. I love to draw and build stuff. My parents told me that career choice would require a lot of math. I was only 11 or so, and I thought, I really don’t want to be doing math all day. I ended up being a pharmacist and it requires more math than an architect. I wish I was an architect but I am happy that I am a pharmacist. Certainly not a loser. Also, I had a friend’s dad try and talk me out of being a pharmacist and owning my own stores. People see the negative and not the positive.

No. Almost no one gets the career they wanted. I have known self - made multimillionaires who have bitterly told me that they didn't get the career they wanted. However, if you are alive and not making your life by criminal acts and hurting people then you are basically successful. You can keep trying for the original plan. Or you can decide to be more successful in what you are doing. Or you can decide to do something else. Life is what happens while we are making plans.

Loser? No. Unlucky? Maybe. I don’t have a career I wanted, but I’m healthy and somewhat happy. It’s tough when you’re in a job you know you shouldn’t be in but you have bills to pay and mouths to feed. Just part of life. It bothers me, but you just have to man up and either accept it or find a way to do something else. Neither choice is easy to make.

Do you have any doubt about that yes you are but you can be satisfied by one thing You are not the only one ……There are crores(seeing the population of our country) of assholes who just put down there head and work like a donkey whole day the only day you raise ur head is on the salary day and you feel like a king untill u are unmarried once u are married this is also taken from u. And it's no surprise I am also one among these crores people. So just wait for the weekend and swallow ur dream and passion as a pill with beer and chill
No. Life has a way of throwing us curves. There are a lot of college grads who aren't working in the field their degree is in. If you are working, do the best you can. You are not a loser.

Of course not. The important thing is that u have a career that makes u happy. Many at times we dont get what we want in life but that doesn't make you a loser. Being happy is the most important thing

Definitely yes! Sorry for being harsh .. but yes, you are a loser. You can never be a winner unless you know you are a looser.But it’s never too late. Arise, awake, and stop not till the goal is reached.- Swami Vivekananda All the best!

No. You are not. Try something else , till you get satisfaction. People do engineering to become an engineer, then they do MBA to get into management field. Keep working , until you reach to a conclusion. All the best.
